content.description: When you really want to squeeze in one more route down here on the left side, trying climbing the line between Sex is Violence and Strong Girl.  More fun and less contrived then one might expect.
content.protection: Clip the bolts on Sex is Violence but climb to their left.
content.location: Start same as Sex is Violence but instead of moving immediately right head up and left.

content.description: Crank on small holds to a break (crux), then make easier moves on good pockets and jugs to a mantel/beached whale move at the top. The powerful direct start feels out of character with the rest of the route, and can be avoided by starting to the left and traversing out along the break (this drops the overall grade to mid-5.10.)
content.protection: 4 bolts to Mussy Hooks shared with Sex Is Violence.
content.location: Right of the big crack/chimney at the right end of Nose Rock, look for two bolt lines left of the roof. Strong Girl is the left route.

content.description: A reachy start on big holds leads to a tricky crux between the second and third bolts. Above the third bolt, the route follows an easier (but very fun) arête past two more bolts to the anchors. Cool and thoughtful moves up excellent rock.
content.protection: 5 bolts to shuts. First bolt can be clipped from the ground. Please use quickdraws when toproping to reduce wear on the anchors.
content.location: Pass under the large roof at the right end of Nose Rock. There are two bolt lines with shared anchors that go just left of the roof (Strong Girl and Sex Is Violence). Walk past these and Spinal Tap is the next line of bolts on the right.

content.description: Mono with some other pockets and then the crux.
content.location: Nose Rock on the west side of the Pit

content.description: Awesome moves right off the start to easier climbing up top with a sweet mantle finish.  Flail like a whale!
content.protection: 5 or six bolts?  You can see them from the ground to two bolt anchors.
content.location: To the right of Strong Girl.  Just left of large overhang

content.description: Hardest Route at The Pit.  Overhanging arete 5th route from the left.
content.location: Nose Rock all the way to the West of The Pit

content.description: 6th route from the left. Tuff start and some thin holds.
content.protection: 4 bolts but might not have an anchor
content.location: Nose Rock all the way to the West of The Pit

content.description: Deceptively good holds at the bottom hide a reachy crux undercling move and a technical sequence onto the slab. Runout but easier climbing above reaches the same anchors as About Face.
content.location: The second bolt line from the left on Nose Rock, just left of a steepening bulge. Work up to shared open shuts.

content.description: This recently retro bolted route was first ascended by Melissa Wruck BITD and then chopped because another climber wanted to use the hangers. Thin moves past the first two bolts leads to bigger moves to buckets and jugs for the finish.There is another TR to the right called Wild, Wild West.
content.location: Right of Hooking Red Nectar behind a tree up a sketchy slope that should clean up in due time.
On the upper tier above About Face and Monster Mash.

content.description: Funky moves off the start to thin pulling
content.location: As you are heading down to send Aggro Arete this is the first route you come to past the shooting gallery.  Starts right above the chossy gully

content.description: boulder problem start, move past 4 bolts and chains anchor. Led routes with hooks & little blue aliens, fun route.  Built it for Maria, when she gets older.
content.location: The route is located between Castillo and Hookin Red Nectar,

content.description: Just past Hookin Red Nectar,  big long moves off the start to balancey power moves.  Fun climbing but not sure if its "13c" as I've heard some people call it.
content.location: Just before you get to Sex is Violence

content.description: A beautiful and fairly sustained line on solid, pale-colored stone in the center of the cliff. Bouldery moves off the deck and a throw to a good shelf are followed by awesome long pulls between positive pockets and edges. Highly recommended.
content.protection: 4 bolts and Mussy Hooks at the top.
content.location: On the main wall of Nose Rock, this is the fourth bolt line from the right and is just left of Aggro Arete, trending up and slightly left.

content.description: Baffling, bouldery start over a steep bulge leads to easier face climbing on decent rock. An okay route if you're running out of other 5.11 leads, otherwise give it a miss.
content.location: Sandwiched in between Aggro Arete and Spinal Tap near the right end of Nose Rock.

content.description: Powerful yet technical moves up the arete, one of the coolest routes at the Pit and one of the gems of the far left side!
content.protection: 4 or 5 bolts to 2 bolt anchor.  Some books call this route R/X not sure where the big danger lies, however taking whippers off this is exciting!
content.location: Situated just between Avalon and Anasazi Eyes.  First moves off small crimps up to finger lock and into some more crazy balancy moves.

content.description: Cruxy pocket moves get you off the ground and past the first bolt, then big holds lead through a slabby section and over the upper bulge. A worthy moderate lead, though short.
content.location: The farthest left bolt line on Nose Rock, starting just right of a pine tree.

content.description: Nose Rock is the farthest left (west) developed cliff at The Pit. Most of the routes here are fairly short, but the rock is high quality with lots of great edges and pockets. Quality climbing with a wide range of difficulty.
